website_summaries.verdict: Smart light switch with a sleek design and great connectivity. Great choice for the homeowner who wants to simplify life.
pros: Once installed, easy to set and forget
Offers a feature for randomization of lights when away on vacation
Hands-free control works well with Amazon Alexa
cons: Some reviewers found setup and installation a bit difficult

website_summaries.verdict: Pricey up front, but this no-hub-required smart switch can pay for itself with savings on electric bills.
pros: Controllable via smartphone from anywhere in the world, using an app that's very intuitive and lets users set light schedules quickly
Location-based automatic timer is a nice plus
cons: Some may have issues wiring the unit as it requires a neutral lead

website_summaries.verdict: The Belkin WeMo Light Switch is a little expensive, but it's mostly a solid a la carte option for DIYers interested in home automation.
pros: The Belkin WeMo Light Switch makes it easy to control overhead lights, fans, or other switch-plate-connected devices remotely via smartphone or tablet
cons: It requires a direct connection to your wall wiring, which will make installation nerve-wracking for some, and impossible for others
Could also use a dimming option

customer_reviews.title: Connecting to phone never works
customer_reviews.text: Love the actual switch on the wall. Just a simple tap turns on/off. HATE HATE that it never works from my phone. I have a new current Android. It won't connect or the lights switch device is updating or today it said can't find device. So aggravated. It is the reason why I bought it. It has worked twice. There are a lot less expensive light switches if that is all it's going to do.
customer_reviews.author: TS

customer_reviews.title: Poor Networking
customer_reviews.text: Poor networking code, I could not get this product to install on my network (actually tried to WiFI networks that I have running Netgear Router and Unfi), The router logs would spit out the following: WLAN access rejected: incorrect security. I read some troubleshooting suggestions that recommended to turn off security, rename the WiFi, change the password. As I have successfully installed TPLink products on the same network, and have no issues with other WiFi connections, PC's, Phones, Roku, TV's, Echo, EcoBee, etc I opted out from lengthy troubleshooting and ordered a similar switch from TPLink (I know which brand to stick with and which to avoid at this point).
customer_reviews.author: mrp

customer_reviews.title: Does not work with Alexa
customer_reviews.text: I have had it with these things. I installed them in my entire house and now I wish I didn't! Always says device is unresponsive when I try to use them with Alexa. So I basically just installed an over priced regular light switch in my home that only works sometimes! DONT BUY. I CONTACTED CUSTOMERS SERVICE AND THEY ARE NO HELP. THEY TRY TO JUST ACT LIKE YOU MADE A MISTAKE IN THE INSTALLATION OR SET UP!
customer_reviews.author: Sunnie

customer_reviews.title: Will not stay connected to WiFi
customer_reviews.text: I would suggest another brand or model smart switch. After two years of fighting my Wemo smart switches device spontaneously disconnecting from WiFi, I have replaced all my Wemo devices with those of another brand. I might add that I have been using two other manufacturers smart switches om the same WiFi with no difficulty over the same time period. Several times a month one of the Wemo devices would disconnect and restoring the connection would require anything from cycling power to resetting and reprogramming the switch. Since this happened with two different routers and did not occur with other brand smart switches, I must assume that the Wemo devices were the culprit..
customer_reviews.author: Frank Faris

customer_reviews.title: Don’t buy Wemo products
customer_reviews.text: When it works it’s great. Problem is that in the year and half I’ve owned it the product rarely works. I have 600 mb/s connection with top of the line router and modem ($600) and it still does not connect 95% of the time. It’s been the same through two different routers and modems. It may go a few day stretch connected when first installed but that’s it. I’ve cleared everything and started fresh and still have issues. Positive reviews must be from initial instruction as I purchased and installed 7 various units and have over a year of troubleshooting and using wemo products. Junk.
customer_reviews.author: Kujo

customer_reviews.title: Love the on at sunset, off at sunrise feature
customer_reviews.text: Can’t say enough about these wemo light switches. Install fairly quickly, integrate seamlessly with our WiFi, ALWAYS works. I use them for our front and back door lights, and they have never disappointed. While they work great with Alexa, I just always use the Wemo app if I need to change time, turn on or off in a flash. I use the on with sunset, off with sunrise feature. It’s like Wemo for dummies!! You never have to think about changing the on and off times through the seasons. I’ve bought 4 of these switches so far, and they all work perfectly! Just set it and go!!
customer_reviews.author: M. Murphy

customer_reviews.title: Works great, but watch for sales as they are expensive
customer_reviews.text: Loving these light switches. We've been slow to incorporate connected devices beyond computer / tablet type items. We went this route to program our exterior lights on the porch and garage instead of replacing our current lights. While we could have picked up garage lights with dusk/dawn sensors, they were much more expensive than replacing the switch that controlled them. Our porch lights are recessed and the dusk/dawn option just isn't available. These light switches solved those problems and were a breeze to install. Our boxes are a bit crowded, but we were able to safely tuck all the wires back into the box mainly to the side of these rather deep WeMo switches.
customer_reviews.author: Rich

customer_reviews.title: Wemo to Google Assistant connection down
customer_reviews.text: Just installed it, not bad installation, a bit bulky so its a snug fit on a 2-gang. The three way switch setup is super easy compared to the single pole setup, but it comes with an extra wire, which may confuse people. Deal breaker: cannot connect to Wemo to Google Assistant right now. When I try, I get: "Couldn't update the setting. Check your connection" errors. I'll give it another day and see if it works, otherwise these are going back. Probably try TP link, they're a fraction of the price.
customer_reviews.author: R. Duong

customer_reviews.title: Works ... and then "Not detected"
customer_reviews.text: Installed this switch with latest update .. worked overnight, This morning, away from home, the switch is "not detected" in the WEMO app. I still can control it through Alexa but the app is useless. I have smart devices from other brands that cost half with less features but work non-stop. I will give this device a week and then it will go back to Amazon if the performance is not up to expectation for a $40 light switch. Edit: To the WEMO support who suggested to email. Did that even before I posted. Did not receive a reply ... soooo ... sounded like a good idea in theory.
customer_reviews.author: Frank

customer_reviews.title: Makes things easy
customer_reviews.text: Advantages works very well and integrates well with the Wi-Fi even if you do not have the best router. Works well with voice activation I have an Alexa. Works well with the app schedules is very good whether you using app and/or you are using voice activation. Disadvantages It sometimes needs to have updates that will interfere with using them remotely or voice activated. Sometimes the voice activation cannot control them. Bottom line I love my WeMo products and I love doing things remotely it's good for safety especially when you're traveling or if you're coming home in the night and it is good when you are just too lazy to move:)
customer_reviews.author: V

customer_reviews.title: Can not connect to WI FI
customer_reviews.text: Does not work with routers that can't be remote enabled or able to use the MAC address on the light switch, there is no customer support. I waited for 20 minutes only to speak with someone who couldn't help, and was told another WEMO tech would call me back in four hours, no one ever called back! after trying three hours to enable this, then reading the WEMO support forums on line, and almost 30 other people having the exact same problem with trying to connect to Wi FI. I gave up and will send this back. I will try the IRIS wall switch that is better suited for linkup with the Ecco Dot.
customer_reviews.author: Larry

customer_reviews.title: Stay away if you use iPhone or iPad.
customer_reviews.text: IOS app so full of bugs, the product is unusable. 1. App will often fail to connect to a device, yet the device responds to Alexa commands. Therefore not a user or hardware problem, but the app. 2. Setting up a new Wemo device, app fails to connect to WiFi network initially, but if you try to connect to an alternate Wifi network, it connects to the first one tried. In summary, their iOS app is complete garbage. I’ve spent several hours with Belkin tech support on this but they won’t acknowledge their app is crap. I switched to TP-Link and setups have worked flawlessly.
customer_reviews.author: Bigdog

customer_reviews.title: Things to be aware of
customer_reviews.text: Doesn't work with 3 way switches (lights that have multiple switches to turn them on). Though you may be able to work around that if you know what you're doing. Doesn't work without a Neutral wire (the white one - older construction my not have it). Once you get past that it works pretty well, and works with Alexa. Only the bottom is button, so it doesn't toggle/rock like regular switches (not a problem, but throwing it out there).
customer_reviews.author: D. Kelly

customer_reviews.title: Doesn’t work for long.
customer_reviews.text: Don’t buy. App stops working anytime between 6 months to a year.
customer_reviews.author: MD ain't bad

customer_reviews.title: Needs common wire
customer_reviews.text: These switches are easy to install if you have a common wire. I have a 10 year old house, so it did have the common wire in the wall, but wasn't used by any other switch. Took a chance and hooked up switch to this anonymous wire and it worked! I've scheduled these lights to come on at sunset each day. This will be nice this winter when it's dark when we get home from work..
customer_reviews.author: E. Woodford

customer_reviews.title: Works as advertised, no dropped connections.
customer_reviews.text: No issues, maintains Wifi connection (no drops), clear instructions. Ended up purchasing 7 switches, all working correctly. WeMo app (ios) easy to navigate & setup. WeMo app bug: if you select 'remember WiFi connection info' AND the connect to home WiFi fails (forgot to turn router back on) the failed WiFi connection info is saved thus failing subsequent connection attempts until you de-select 'remember WiFi connection info'; bottom-line: failed WiFi connection info should NOT be saved!!! Alexa integration just works.
customer_reviews.author: Stan Smith

customer_reviews.title: Does not reconnect after power outage!
customer_reviews.text: I really like the look of these light switches, but the thing that I find very annoying is that if there is a power outage it has a hard time to reconnect. Most of the time I would have to hit the reset button before I can control it via app or Alexa. There are even times that I had to do a full set up again before it would connect. I went with another brand when I got dimmer and they never have this issue. But when it is connected it works well and seamless with Alexa.
customer_reviews.author: Natalie

customer_reviews.title: No security whatsoever
customer_reviews.text: No security whatsoever. The switch works and can be controlled by the app. However, anyone with access to your WiFi network and the Wemo app installed can see and control your switch. Did you have a friend over for lunch and give them your WiFi password? Congratulations, you have now given them permission to control your light switches too. There's not so much as a PIN number. Go read the Wemo forums where people are also able to see random other devices that don't belong to them and control them too. Unbelievably bad software design.
customer_reviews.author: Michelle Brooksby

customer_reviews.title: Great when they work.
customer_reviews.text: The Wemo light switches and mini outlets work great in general, but they definitely have their flaws. If you use the physical button and schedule, you'll have no problems after you've got the device installed and setup. However, if you like to control your switches through the app, you'll constantly find that they're offline. Wait awhile and they'll come back, about 20 minutes it seems. I love these switches, but that bug infuriates me to no end. Thankfully even if the switches are offline, they'll still follow any rules you've already got setup. I really hope Belkin fixes this issue soon.
customer_reviews.author: Shawn Browning

customer_reviews.title: Great addition to my home.
customer_reviews.text: I was looking for a solution to automatically turn the outside lights on for me. I needed this because when I get home after work, it's pretty much pitch black around the house. These light switches allows for the user to put them on a schedule to turn on and off anytime they choose and that's exactly what I did. I've ordered 3 of these, installed them myself and connected them to the wifi and I don't think I'll go back to regular. It's beginning of a smart home for me and they are so affordable which is surprising to me.
customer_reviews.author: AndrewTop Contributor: Photography

customer_reviews.title: NOT compatible
customer_reviews.text: NOT compatible.. I was told by Belkin which is WEMO that it is not compatible with newer android 10 and 11 versions software they say they r working on a app upgrade.. and it will be about another month so now I have a regular LIGHT SWITCH.. They r completely useless as my wemo lightswitch is also.. They told me to borrow someones older android phone to set it up but still the app is horrible and complete garbage..
customer_reviews.author: Jorge Gomez

customer_reviews.title: Adds features but interfered with garage door opener
customer_reviews.text: Worked well to control the lights and paired easily with Google Home and Amazon Echo. I wish the click sounded higher quality and that the top of the switch was angled in to look like a standard switch and indicate where to press. Unfortunately, it caused detriment interference with my garage door openers so I returned it. The garage remotes only worked within a few feet of the garage after the switch was installed. I replaced this Week switch with a TP-Link Kasa switch and my garage door openers went back to working a few houses away while still gaining voice control of the lights.
customer_reviews.author: Jason

customer_reviews.title: Disgusted - this is the old version
customer_reviews.text: I looked specially for the wemo wall switch that was compatible with Apple HomeKit. I even saved the screen shot of the description. The product that I received is only compatible with a bridge. I tried to contact the seller to resolve my issue. The only contact information is for tech support. They couldn’t resolve. I should have bought directly from WEMO to make sure I got the right version. The price was the same but Amazon delivery was better.
customer_reviews.author: SolarWorks

customer_reviews.title: Easy way to automate your house.
customer_reviews.text: Works great. I have it connected to Alexa and Apple HomeKit. The switch does need the Wemo bridge to work with Apple it’s easy to set up. FYI the Wemo Dimmer switch does not need the bridge. I use both versions. I have about 15 between the two models active in my house. I especially like one of the HomeKit features that turns on all of my outside lights and a couple of the inside lights when we get within 200 feet of the house coming home after dark. If you don’t use the HomeKit the Wemo app also works great.
customer_reviews.author: Ron G

customer_reviews.title: Can only control Wemo's of 1 Wifi-network.
customer_reviews.text: The switch itself is fine, but in the 2 years that I've had, I've had to reset it at least 3 times as it just stops responding to the app. It's just kinda annoying. The app also has this limitation where you can only control the devices of 1 wifi network. So if you have 2 wifi routers or a wemo at your parents etc, you can only control the wemo where you set up the first one.
customer_reviews.author: Christine Mei

customer_reviews.title: Set and forget.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this a while ago to control my outside lights. It works well and I've been happy with it. I have it set to turn on at dusk and off at 10:30pm. Once it was set via my Android phone I haven't had to touch it. The software is well design and easy to use. I can see if it's on or off via the phone, and looking at the switch, the led shows when it's on or off. My only request would be to allow the software to turn it on at dusk - 30 minutes, but it doesn't have that option. Otherwise, it's a good design and works well.
customer_reviews.author: ChillKodama

customer_reviews.title: Unreliable at best
customer_reviews.text: I like the switch itself...when it works. Unfortunately, the software is klugey as heck. I use these switches to control security lighting and space heaters in my mountain house. When I need remote control the most, these switches just drop of the network. I even have a timer to reboot my router due to these WEMO drop outs....not even a router reboot will bring these back up. It always happens when I need them most...like when I need to cut the lights on due to a security camera alert, or I need to add some extra supplemental heat to the house.
customer_reviews.author: Red Rocks 2015

customer_reviews.title: The best way to control devices by "rules" like sunrise/sunset or time of day.
customer_reviews.text: I used the built in function "sunrise/sunset" rule on the Wemo app to control my driveway lights. I have another that controls a 1/2 horse pond fountain. These surprise me with their capacity and delight me with their program-ability if you use IFTTT (Google that). Has to be installed where a good Wi-Fi signal exists under your control (password secured).
customer_reviews.author: Am4zon3r

customer_reviews.title: Could not get this switch to stay paired to my WiFi network
customer_reviews.text: This switch would attach to my network and then disconnect within minutes. I had to continually install it, and after the 7th r 8th attempt, i gave up and returned it. Since then, I have found an alternate solution that has been rock solid since it was installed.
customer_reviews.author: Stavros 55

customer_reviews.title: Buy from another manufacturer that backs up their product.
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this product approx 6 months ago, was working fine. Last week it would not stay connected. Tried calling tech support, stayed on hold several times for over 30 mins, no one ever answered. It was a good product for a few months, but for the money, it should last a lot longer if not for a duration of infinity. Then, if something goes wrong, you would think (as their literature exclaims, support 24/7) someone would at least answer the phone. At this point, do not recommend.
customer_reviews.author: E. L. Wiseman

customer_reviews.title: Works greats
customer_reviews.text: Works great , took less than ten minutes at my pokey pace to install . Took only another couple of minutes to get the app to recognize the switch . While returning home from work on the evening of the install I turned on my living room lights and since Wifey was home alone and didn't realize the switch was installed , she got a tad bit frightened but soon figured out what was going on and gave me a little chewing out . (I giggled like a ten year old) Highly recommended , just tell your spouse ahead of time ........... or not .
customer_reviews.author: Bcher

customer_reviews.title: Excellent wifi switch for outside lights
customer_reviews.text: This switch is awesome. I'm able to turn on my porch light before I get home and while I'm away. I also really like the schedule functions that allow you program the switch to be on/off on specific days at specific times. The firmware updates are sometimes goofy when updating. If you have other Wemo products this switch integrates seamlessly
customer_reviews.author: aalong

customer_reviews.title: Easily automate your home
customer_reviews.text: This is the second one of these I've purchased. They are extremely easy to install and connected to my Alexa and Wi-Fi flawlessly. If you're looking for wireless control of your house lights, this is definitely for you. Quality built, I've had my first one for a couple years and have never had issues with it. I honestly don't know why it took me so long to buy the second one, I will definitely be converting the rest of the light switches in my house to these.
customer_reviews.author: Charlie Brown

customer_reviews.title: Love with a big but...
customer_reviews.text: Installs easily but the app interface is frustrating. One thing to know: If you have two locations you need two devices for the app. Seems crazy but Belkin confirmed only ONE location per device. So if you have a vacation home or are rolling in money and have mansions in several states or counties you'll need an extra phone or tablet for each. Because of this, I would choose another brand if I were starting anew but will keep the functioning units in place. I'd have to call this one a love-hate relationship.
customer_reviews.author: Susan

customer_reviews.title: Make sure your home is wired properly for this switch or it will not work.
customer_reviews.text: This product may work with Alexa, but I was unable to find out because it won't work with the way the lighting in my house is wired. Nowhere on the Amazon page does it say that you have to have an available neutral wire to install this device. My house is "loop" wired and does not have neutral wires in the switch boxes. The instructions direct you to their website if you do not have a neutral wire to connect to. The website then tells you that this switch will not work in your home. It would have been much easier if that was stated on the Amazon page in the first place.
customer_reviews.author: Geary N Launder

customer_reviews.title: Don't waste your money
customer_reviews.text: This thing worked great....for a few months. Then we lost power and when it came back the switch never worked right again it turned on and off randomly and then just stopped turning the light on at all. We called customer service and got given 4 different numbers to call and transferred 6 different times. Over an hour wasted to get absolutely no where. Do not waste your money because if you do have issues you will get absolutely no help.
customer_reviews.author: Amanda C.

customer_reviews.title: Works but not compatible with Apple home kit.
customer_reviews.text: Easy to install but the product info is not correct in the ad. It says this switch is compatible with Apple home kit but it is not. Still works with the Wemo app and works. Would have given it five stars if the ad wasn’t incorrect. Update: the website says it’s compatible but it’s not. When you call customer service they say you have to buy the more expensive one and can’t say why there is false advertisements on their website. Included a picture.
customer_reviews.author: Stretch

customer_reviews.title: DONT BUY IT...
customer_reviews.text: DONT BUY IT .... IMPOSSIBLE TO CONNECT TO THE WIFI, WE DONE EVERYTHING AND THE TROUBLESHOOTING.... BUY TP LINK, WORKS RIGHT AWAY .....
customer_reviews.author: Adamtshik

customer_reviews.title: Great product, easy install, where's HomeKit?
customer_reviews.text: I just purchased 2 additional switches - have been using another for about 2 years now and I would highly recommend. I only ding a star because they're not Apple HomeKit compatible, but otherwise it's a great product. Everything is easy - install took me an hour to install a double switch. It was a bit of a challenge trying to figure out what to do with the neutral wires - ultimately figured out I had to wire all of the neutrals together. Everything else was easy, and worked well with a Lutron screwless plate.
customer_reviews.author: Spencer Lewis

customer_reviews.title: Lack of customer support caused me to treturn this item and give it a 1 star review.
customer_reviews.text: I have done a lot of home electrical wiring in my day, so imagine my confusion of the way this product was wired. I was 99% sure it has the extra wires to power the WiFi part of the switch, so I called their tech support number...4 TIMES. Not once did they ever answer and I even left a voice mail for a return call. Nothing. I emailed...no reply. I even sent a tweet to their account Nothing. I was not about to blow a $40 switch do to a simple wiring question, There loss.
customer_reviews.author: Hahnarama

customer_reviews.title: Alexa + Wemo = Amazoning!
customer_reviews.text: Installation was straight forward and included wire nuts for installation. I wish there was push in connections instead of wire nuts though was not that big of a deal to use the wire nuts. I was also able to setup each of the 2 switches I purchased within 5 minutes of installation and connecting to my Amazon Alexa and Dots was super simple. I just asked Alexa to find new devices and she found both within 20 seconds and from that point forward I could just say "Alexa turn in living room or Alexa turn on Family room" and the corresponding room lights turned on!
customer_reviews.author: Adam

customer_reviews.title: They aren't developing the app - don't buy.
customer_reviews.text: I have several of these at a couple locations and they work great if you only have them at a single location; however they belkin does not support multi-locations from their app. There solution is to setup the app on 2 separate devices and control them that way... Seriously Belkin?! You claim this is a smart device but the fact that you suggest users use 2 devices to control 2 locations proves that to be false statement. Get with the program and take a look how Nest or Logitec handle multi-locations.. Both their products are actually smart and can handle this functionality with ease natively from their apps.
customer_reviews.author: KPan

customer_reviews.title: No hub required
customer_reviews.text: I have converted most of the house over to the Wemo products. When everything is working they are great but frequently they will drop off or not respond to the Wemo app. Connecting to the Amazon Alexa app has solved many of those problems as the switches seem to maintain that connection even when the Wemo app is not working. Adding new devices at this time is frustrating as the Wemo app continually crashes. Connecting them using an old outdated tablet seems to help but is takes away from a 5 star rating for now.
customer_reviews.author: Josh Kenyon

customer_reviews.title: Does not work!
customer_reviews.text: Don't waste your time and money on this. The one I got did not work. I installed it and set it up exactly per the directions, but it did not work. Tech support failed to answer the phone. The installation videos did not provide a solution that worked. I was unable to connect it with with the lights that it was supposed to switch. It did not operate with the Wemo app nor with the Alexa app. The plugs work OK, but not the switch.
customer_reviews.author: Disco Don

customer_reviews.title: LOVE IT
customer_reviews.text: This is a great product. I did a lot of research on smart switches prior to purchasing and this one seemed to best suit my needs. It was quite easy to install and the set up was even easier. As long as you make sure all your cables are securely connected you shouldn't have any issues. I do have advise though, check your Wi-Fi prior to purchasing, it states it needs at least three bars near the switch for it to work. I placed my phone next to the existing switch to confirm. I had enough Wi-Fi but I know not everyone will.
customer_reviews.author: MeganFromLV

customer_reviews.title: WARNING;  This switch will be useless without a separate neutral in your switchbox.
customer_reviews.text: This switch requires a separate neutral for the electronics to work, so you should look at the diagragm on their website before you buy. The code to include a separate neutral wire was not instituted until 2011, so if your house is older than about 7 years, then you most likely cannot use this switch without having an electrician run a separate neutral first.
customer_reviews.author: mjplatt

customer_reviews.title: Do not buy if you need to control lights in more than one location.
customer_reviews.text: Purchased 2 of the devices to install at 2 separate locations. After installing the second device, the app automatically deleted my first device. Seems that all WEMO devices must be in the same location. Seems that customers have been asking Belkin to address this problem for quite some time. For whatever reason they do not want to fix this serious issue.
customer_reviews.author: KBC

customer_reviews.title: Switches and smart plugs work perfectly
customer_reviews.text: The switches and smart plugs by WeMo work perfectly. If I unplug them or the power goes off they come back and reconnect to the WiFi automatically. If the wifi goes out and comes back they reconnect automatically. The reason for four stars is because the app is a little twitchy. The app running on my Android phone Samsung S6 and my Fire Tablet would sometimes get hung up. The update process is also buggy, as I had to uninstall and reinstall the app, in order for the updates of the switches to work properly. Wimo works very well with Alexa.
customer_reviews.author: PJ

customer_reviews.title: Never again.
customer_reviews.text: I use as dusk dawn garage switch...worked last night and woke up to the dreaded yellow blinking light. This isn’t the first time but it is the last time. Bye bye Wemo...you’ll never see a dime from me again. Owned about a year.
customer_reviews.author: Marcus

customer_reviews.title: Lost 2 switches in 8 months
customer_reviews.text: I got 3 of this product in March of 2018. This product worked well for about 7 months. In the past 2 weeks, 2 of them have started to malfunction. They are no longer accessible via the app. I have followed all the videos published by WEMO without any success. It shows the device as "Not Detected". There has been no change to my network. The only thing I have done is to apply the firmware update. I would say do your research and find an alternate product. I would not recommend this to anyone.
customer_reviews.author: Kiran G. A.ram

customer_reviews.title: Im sure WEMO is a good company, but these wifi enabled switches will slow ...
customer_reviews.text: I had to return the item because it slowed down my internet so much (because it runs off wifi) I replaced the wifi enabled switch with a z-wave outlet. Now i don't have slow internet now because my home automation devises aren't running off of wifi and slowing the internet down! Im sure WEMO is a good company, but these wifi enabled switches will slow your internet down so bad on your laptop that the webpage your trying to bring up will time out and your internet won't work. I couldn't even watch netflix without netflix pausing trying to connect to wifi.
customer_reviews.author: Adrienne

customer_reviews.title: Latest App update makes product worthless
customer_reviews.text: I can no longer log into the WEMO app after the latest update. It doesn't recognize my e-mail to reset my password. I have to start over from scratch configuring my multiple WEMO devices. I'd recommend finding another wireless solution. I have others that don't dump you from their system and waste your time redoing what was already configured.
customer_reviews.author: JD

customer_reviews.title: Unreliable compared to min plug performance
customer_reviews.text: I have had great luck with Wemo mini plugs but this product is some what unreliable. Set up and install was easy and it worked for about half a day. Now it is constantly ‘unresponsive’. Not sure if it was due to a firmware update I installed - still on the fence as to if I will remove it and send it back - I don’t think its a wifi issue because a Wemo min plug is working fine just a few feet away working fine
customer_reviews.author: Obithedog

customer_reviews.title: Works great, and works with a desktop computer app for remote control
customer_reviews.text: Replaced the old switches in a dual gang box, look nice, and work great. But the real reason I bought these was because they work with a Macintosh desktop App called "WSwitch for Belkin WeMo". Now I can press a single key on my Mac computer keyboard and turn the room lights ON, then another key and turn them OFF! It all work very reliably. Office automation the way it is supposed to be!
customer_reviews.author: Roger Robot

customer_reviews.title: Had terrible problems with these
customer_reviews.text: Had terrible problems with these. Constantly disconnected from Wi-Fi. Tried to broadcast SSID. hide SSID, etc. - no avail. Ended up going z-Wave which works perfect, everyday, all the time.
customer_reviews.author: Jonathan Peyton

customer_reviews.title: Great light switches to automate my life.
customer_reviews.text: Installed and set up the light switches in minutes. Took a couple attempts to connect but it wasn't too difficult after turning my phone into airplane mode when launching the app. I set up the schedule to turn on at dusk and turn off as dawn. It figures out the time based on my location. Now I have to see if they last for years. I'm hoping they do. Now I don't have to turn on and off my outside lights. I can automate the routine, useless tasks in my life.
customer_reviews.author: Brandon Marcus

customer_reviews.title: OMG what a pile of crap
customer_reviews.text: I fought for 3 hours trying to get this thing to connect with no success. It is a total pile of crap. I gave up after the 50th reset and attempt.
customer_reviews.author: Scott

customer_reviews.title: The second time is a charm
customer_reviews.text: The switch is a good idea, but the quality control at the factory could be improved. I ordered a light switch and installed in properly...it simply would not connect with the WeMo program or, if it did, it lost that connection shortly thereafter. I finally gave up and returned it requesting a replacement. That replacement was wired in exactly as the other, works perfectly and is a delight to have working with Alexa... I note that others have had similar comments about bad switches so if you order one, be prepared for a possible dud. Having said that, in fairness, I will note that I have ordered another (I hope they don't send me my old one - grin)
customer_reviews.author: gh

customer_reviews.title: Buggy unreliable
customer_reviews.text: I have several switches and the Wemo outlets and they are just unreliable. I was out of town and all the Wemo devices were offline, all my cameras were working so it wasn't a wireless network issue. When I got home I had to reset everyone of the Wemo switches and outlets. I choose Wemo years ago because I thought not having a proprietary gateway was better, hind site 20/20 I was wrong. I have switch to Smartthings zwave and it has been so much more reliable and vastly more functional. I would recommend you stay away from Wemo its poorly supported and very buggy.
customer_reviews.author: D Pork

customer_reviews.title: Great for controlling outside lights tied to a switch.
customer_reviews.text: Works great. Used these to control my porch light and Christmas light decorations on the outside. Set the timer on my iPad and that was it. As daylight changed in December it was easy to adjust a new start time. Great item for people who want to have lights come on outside without the external timers set up outside.
customer_reviews.author: JEM

customer_reviews.title: Not reliable as expected.
customer_reviews.text: This light switch is bulky, not easy to squeeze into the wall switch box, especially for the all style metal wall switch box. And the signal degraded after 1 year. And then the WiFi signal just failed after 2 years. Not able to connect again. And their warranty only 1 year. Will you change your light switch every 2 years? If so, go for it.
customer_reviews.author: BB

customer_reviews.title: half dependable
customer_reviews.text: A cool product but don't count on it when needed. I was approaching my home and needed to turn on light, as this is the situation we bought it for, and it wanted to update my permissions. As I wait in the dark, the update icon spins and I wait... I thankfully have a match in my car console that will get me what I could have had in the sixties, an finally I get in the house. As far as I know it is still updating and I am NEVER buying into the wemo strategy again. I can do the same thing with a match and a prayer. UNEXCEPTABLE wemo. Not what I bargained for you out-of-touch egg heads!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: A tad of challenge to set up.
customer_reviews.text: I have to say the install and setup was more difficult than expected. Was amazed with ease of setup with smart plug, but not so with switches. Also be careful to only use a single home associate. Had issues with Apple but Google was fine. No experience with Alexa. Since using after setup, have been very pleased.
customer_reviews.author: MIkeZ

customer_reviews.title: Great switch, I have 15...
customer_reviews.text: Great smart switch with a fantastic app. The app and functionality within the app is better than any other I’ve used. They run a little more expensive than other brands, but it’s made up in the functionality. I have at least 15 in my house. I just wish the had a 3 way option and that they supported Stringify. It does work with IFTTT.
customer_reviews.author: J. Weilen

customer_reviews.title: These switches are a nightmare - Find another solution
customer_reviews.text: Could not get this to connect to my network. Reviewing the online problem and there's lots of difficulties people are facing with these switches. Spent over 12 hours (2 days screwing around with this thing) total working with their help desk (who pushed me to 2nd stage and then didn't call back) and finally seeing all the crazy poor reviews on the difficulty with these devices. They are a LIFE SUCK!!!! Don't waste your energy.
customer_reviews.author: J. Stewart

customer_reviews.title: Whatever you do... do not buy these swtiches
customer_reviews.text: I made the mistake of wiring up my entire house with these switches and regret it terribly. They randomly turn-off daily. They lose the wifi connection all the time and blink orange. I've even had them fail to even allow you to manually switch the light back. I agree with others who have commented here, they outsource their "tech support" to India and these people are clueless and the product is so buggy and inconsistent that it's nearly impossible to troubleshoot. Firmware updates from Belkin have made the switches worse, not better.
customer_reviews.author: Matt B

customer_reviews.title: Great light timer!
customer_reviews.text: We have been using this as a timer for our front porch lights for the last 2 weeks. Works really well! No problem with connectivity and installation was quick and easy! I had no problem downloading the app to my iPhone and setting the timer rule (dusk to dawn) for our lights. Love not having to manually turn off/on our lights anymore. Will definitely be purchasing more Wemo devices soon!
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for Alexa and IFTTT
customer_reviews.text: Bought this to replace my switch in my garage. Now I can turn lights on using Alexa voice command. Was planning on setting up IFTTT with MyQ garage, but MyQ is having issues. My only complaint is that the wifi icon was broken. Sensor worked fine but the icon only showed half the wifi symbol. Not a big deal since once it is setup you don't see the icon anymore. Setup through WEMO app was simple. My original switch only had 2 wires connected so I had to use common sense to install but it works fine.
customer_reviews.author: nai1817

customer_reviews.title: It works every time with Alexa and IFTTT - love it
customer_reviews.text: Ahh... the joy of home automation. I am happy I chose Wemo for the two light switches recently, I liked the fact that a hub was not necessary. The configuration was simple and integration with Alexa was seamless. Now I have a the fan and main lights in my house on schedule and also integrated with Alexa and IFTTT. The geo location recipe between my iPhone and the Wemo switches works every time; I couldn't be happier. I liked these devices so much I purchased the wall switch as well, so the Christmas tree will finally be on a reliable schedule when the time comes.
customer_reviews.author: Andre Farinazo

customer_reviews.title: I was disappointed because the WEMO could not be used with a ...
customer_reviews.text: Well, first, I was disappointed because the WEMO could not be used with a two way light switch. That is not the products fault. I moved it to another location with a single switch configuration and it works GREAT. I use with my Alexa and I love it. I do however wish I could find something to control my gameroom light which has two light switches at opposite ends of the room. Maybe WEMO can make some suggestions. :)
customer_reviews.author: Gareth W Beattie

customer_reviews.title: Great product will buy again.
customer_reviews.text: Very happy with the product. After reading a bunch of negative reviews I was weary but I bought it anyway. Just as easy as installing a regular switch and syncing with the app takes 30 secs and that’s it. I know people complain that it stops working after awhile and they can’t get it to connect but I recently switched routers and had to reset it and as long as you follow the instructions it’s super easy.
customer_reviews.author: g

customer_reviews.title: Belkin support is horrible. The only thing that makes this product better ...
customer_reviews.text: This Belkin product is extremely buggy. Belkin support is horrible. The only thing that makes this product better is that Amazon is willing to stand behind it. UPDATE: Belkin contacted in response to this post asking me to provide them with feedback on my problem. Belkin's response to my feedback stated "We will forward your case to the appropriate support so they can immediately assist you. They will contact you within the next 24 to 48 hours." Over a week later, Belkin still has not contacted me back in regards to this matter.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great when you need more than a smart outlet switch.
customer_reviews.text: Purchased to allow control of exterior lights when away from home. I have basic wiring skills and was able to install after talking to someone about the "neutral" wire necessity. Added Wemo skill to Alexa and can control through my echo dots. This works with single pole wiring only (no three way switches and requires a neutral wire to function. After installation setup is easy.
customer_reviews.author: Larry Elrod

customer_reviews.title: The WeMo  service goes down constantly, rendering this device useless
customer_reviews.text: This device requires the WeMo service in order to work with Alexa, Google Home, IFTTT, or the app. The problem is this service goes down for days at a time. These outages affect all users and are extremely frustrating. I deeply regret investing in WeMo for my smart outlets and light switches. I really feel like I threw my money away.
customer_reviews.author: Chris Mause

customer_reviews.title: Use the video on Amazon for DIY installation
customer_reviews.text: I'm not that handy, but using the video on Amazon, I was able to install the switch. It would be 5 stars except the instructions in the app were very obtuse about getting on the internet for Android smart phones. I did have to purchase a larger wire nut than was provided as there were 3 common wires in this multiple location switch. The other switch in the housing was one of 3 that controlled some other lights.
customer_reviews.author: PismoPat

customer_reviews.title: Great step to automating your house.
customer_reviews.text: This is the best smart switch I have found. I have six of these throughout my house and they are outstanding. I love how programmable they are. Works simlessly with Alexa.
customer_reviews.author: Cynthia J. Starke

customer_reviews.title: Junk
customer_reviews.text: While they worked these switches reset themselves about twice a week and had to be reinstalled via the WeMo app. The app tended to continuously restart unless I rebooted the phone several times. The final straw was the 2 switches bricking during the automatic online firmware process. BUY SOMETHING ELSE
customer_reviews.author: James Harren

customer_reviews.title: works but could be better
customer_reviews.text: there are two reasons why this product does not get a 5 star. the first is that the product after a period of time disconnects and has to be reconnected to the wifi. the second is that it refuses to update. other than that the product works when it does. it allows to turn on and off remotely.
customer_reviews.author: michael

customer_reviews.title: Best switch ever.
customer_reviews.text: I just don't know why everyone is giving this wemo switch a bad reviews. I have 32 of this switch at home, and none of them fail. It has been working perfectly and the best thing about it is that you don't need any router or bridge it's a stand alone switch. And the customer service is awesome very nice people and very knowledgeable.
customer_reviews.author: DCJ2045

customer_reviews.title: Works great -- wait for it to go on sale!
customer_reviews.text: This light switch was super easy to install and setup. The whole process took less than 10 minutes. It integrates beautifully with Alexa and you can even setup a schedule if needed. These switches go on sale pretty frequently so don't buy it at full price!
customer_reviews.author: CK

customer_reviews.title: Happy with purchase
customer_reviews.text: I am a DIY person, and have replaced light switches and also have Wemo plugs. This is the first wemo wall switch type. This was easy to do. Maybe took 15 minutes electrical and 5 with software. Works great. I also added as a device for Alexa. There is a video which would be helpful for anyone not familiar. If you DIY, you must turn off power and you must make sure wire connections are tight and secure.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Safety and ease of use.
customer_reviews.text: I love the ability to turn off and on my lights no matter where I am. The only problem I have had is that sometimes the connection disconnects and is difficult to reestablish. But that slight problem is nothing when you consider that you can turn on or off lights even if away from the house. This is a safety factor.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great switch! Wifi network makes all the difference
customer_reviews.text: I've had this switch installed for a little over a year. I use it to turn on my outside lights. It programs easily and I love having the ability to turn on and off remotely, as well as set a recurring timer to go on and off after dusk. Only challenge I've experienced is the Wifi connection in my network sometimes drops--but that's because I now have a dozen devices on my router...time to upgrade the home network! I wish the switch was easier to change wifi settings, perhaps just a setting in-app, but it may be more difficult by design to keep it secure from being hijacked.
customer_reviews.author: Paul

customer_reviews.title: Awesome wifi light switch!
customer_reviews.text: I have minimal knowledge of wiring and this couldn't be any easier to install. Everything is labeled for easy and quick installation of this product. Only took me about 10 minutes. I have this paired with my Amazon echo which allows me to control turning this on and off with voice alone. I will be buying more. I currently have my front porch lights, dining room chandelier and two fans being controlled with this switch. The ability to schedule lights to turn off and on automatically is also an excellent feature! Highly recommended product here!
customer_reviews.author: Eric Centanni

customer_reviews.title: Great product with a functional app.
customer_reviews.text: I really like these switches. I have several now in my house. I have a background doing electrical work so no issue for me to install. Some may be intimidated by the installation. They work all the time and the application is particularly good as it offers many ways to programmatically manage your switch connected devices (i.e. light fixtures, etc.).
customer_reviews.author: Willie T

customer_reviews.title: Easy peasy and reliable
customer_reviews.text: We bought these switches to connect into our Google Home and it has worked flawlessly. I am able to use the WEMO mobile app to setup multiple rules per switch and everything works as expected. The frmware updates that Belkin sends out update with no issues and makes me feel more secure knowing updates are installing correctly and frequently.
customer_reviews.author: Jason Williams

customer_reviews.title: save the packaging
customer_reviews.text: Save the packaging. All I wanted was to turn on/off 4 lights when I am not here. Sunset driven on times. Clock driven off times. Dimming a plus. $300 worth of these devices worked as I programmed them for a few days. Then the app asked me for "up to" 10 minutes for a "firmware upgrade". Flash forward to hundreds of minutes and restarts. No upgrade. Some devices do not reload no matter what. Terrible tech support. Sanity requires a return to x 10.
customer_reviews.author: E. Tucker

customer_reviews.title: This product changed my mind on wemo
customer_reviews.text: The app sucks. I was a fan at 1st. Then if my router losses power, or new password, and anything really the app would "not detect" the light switch. To fix this I had to delete the app, reset the light switch (huge pita), re-install everything. No huge deal... Until now, about 3 months or so into owning it at the last step of the install the app loses the device and tells me to start over... Worst of all for some f'n reason while it is not on wifi about half the time it doesn't turn on manually at the switch!?!
customer_reviews.author: Keving81

customer_reviews.title: because it appears to be a great product. Trying to leave a review for the ...
customer_reviews.text: The Wemo Light Switch could not be made to fit into our existing switch box. Old house, with thick old wiring. Bummer, because it appears to be a great product. Trying to leave a review for the Wemo Insight Switch, but it's linking to our Wemo Light Switch review. At any rate, the Wemo Insight Switch is great, easy to set up, and works well. Wish it were $10-15 cheaper, and that's why we'd rate it 4 starts vs 5. Would also be good to have an option for it that doesn't require a 3 prong outlet.
customer_reviews.author: Jean

customer_reviews.title: Not impressed
customer_reviews.text: Each time I asked Alexa to turn the light on or off their is a time lapse. The light does work, however because of the time lapse, Alexa says to check the internet and electrical connection. This only happens with this manufacturer. All others work as they should
customer_reviews.author: Dion

customer_reviews.title: Great WiFi switch! Perfect compliment to the Amazon Echo.
customer_reviews.text: I hooked the WeMo switch up to my Amazon Echo and now I can turn on lights by saying Alexa, garage light on. I can also control the lights from my Android phone with the WeMo app. Wiring up the switch was easy as was connecting it to my network. It was a simple following of the included instructions. Once it was installed and connected to the network, the Echo found it without any issues. Turning it on and off while on the same network is nearly instant. When turning it on and off from different networks there is a little lag of less than a second. Overall I think this WiFi switch is awesome and I love it!
customer_reviews.author: IB

customer_reviews.title: Set it up and forget it; it just works
customer_reviews.text: I been using it for a couple months and really enjoy this switch. I did have a small issue setting it up do to the app freezing up when I was configuring it and there was no documentation to help. but customer service help me reset it within 5 minutes and it’s worked perfectly since then. It controlling my outside garage lots and is set on the sunset/sunrise schedule, which is great. I’m looking at other switches, around my house, to replace with these.
customer_reviews.author: tiff

customer_reviews.title: Instant smart home!
customer_reviews.text: We bought these to use around the house. After installing a couple we have now replaced all of our switches with them. They are easy to use and make smart house integration easy. We use the timer feature & IFTTT for guests and other smart home products integration, and the location feature to make sure the lights are on outside when we get home. A must for pet owners who forget to turn the lights on for their puppies.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan Gomez

customer_reviews.title: A Reliable Solution
customer_reviews.text: I have installed two of these switches in my house and was very pleased with the results. They work very reliable. I then installed two more at my beach house and have been very pleased with them too. The setup is somewhat straight forward but the defining of routines takes some trial and error. but once set they never seem to fail. I highly recommend them.
customer_reviews.author: R. Helmick

customer_reviews.title: Power outage renders it useless
customer_reviews.text: Does not revert to its last setting after a power outage. If it was set to on, and then lost power, the device stays off. You need to manually turn it back on. When Wemo will have an option of it reverting back to its last setting I’ll reconsider the rating.
customer_reviews.author: Happy customer

customer_reviews.title: Disappointing
customer_reviews.text: Only works 1/3 of the time. My other Wemo products are great. This doesn’t “register” on the app the majority of the time, defeating the purpose for why I bought it. It’s also super bright at night so if you can’t sleep with light in the room, don’t buy.
customer_reviews.author: Stephanie Mac

customer_reviews.title: Wemo products rock
customer_reviews.text: I know own 9 of these, I started buying these to eliminate my outdoor light timers. Installation is simple if your handy and knowing that all my outside lights will go on and off at the same time and NEVER rest or lose their time ..... SOOOOO HAPPY !!!! Now I have them on my living room light and under cabinet lights with on and off timers too.... love them and their iPhone interface is very easy to use and intuitive. Not to mention it work with Alexa so I can tell her to turn them on and off when I need to. Can't wait to see what Belkin / Wemo come up with next. IOT rocks
customer_reviews.author: Michael M

customer_reviews.title: It works as advertised...
customer_reviews.text: I prefer the Belking IoT eco system as they seems to at least be evolving their products over the years. Pricier but I've never had any problems. I installed this in less than 30 minutes. The plate on the switch (not the face plate) is thicke than normal switches so it took a little longer to adjust as I had three switch rocker panel, but eventually I got it adjusted properly.
customer_reviews.author: JREWORLD

customer_reviews.title: Works well.. good intergration
customer_reviews.text: Works well.. like the integration with alexa Would buy again
customer_reviews.author: William

customer_reviews.title: Great Switch, Good WiFi Range, Needs 3-Way Capability
customer_reviews.text: I use this switch in my basement so I can turn on the lights before going down into the dark. My router is quite a ways from the switch and it still works, which was impressive. It was easy to install, and works great as a normal switch, and of course via wifi. My only two wishes is that this would work on 3-way switches so I could wire more of my apartment with these, as I love them, but so far, only 2 way. And the WeMo app is ok, but not great. But regardless, it does the job nicely, and looks nice as well. I'd definitely get more for the switches that are compatible.
customer_reviews.author: Dan J

product_meta.title: Wemo Light Switch, WiFi enabled, Works with Alexa and the Google Assistant (F7C030fc)
product_meta.description: Style:Light Switch| Pattern Name:SingleSoftware requirements : Android 4.4 or higher , iOS 9 or higher and neutral wire required which replaces single pole switch and the product is not compatible with 3-way (multi-location control) switches and always works with your existing single/double/multi-switch rocker-style plates and also the product is not designed to work with metal face plates
feature_bullets: Works with Alexa for voice control (Alexa device sold separately)
WeMo light switch seamlessly replaces your old wall light switch. Control you lights from WeMo light switch on the wall, The WeMo app, and even your voice with both Amazon alexa and Google assistant
Set SCHEDULES and timers. Set porch light to turn on at sunset. Schedule ceiling fans to turn before you arrive home. Sync on and off times to Sunrise and sunset, and more

Works with Amazon alexa and Google assistant. Pair WeMo light switch with Amazon alexa or Google Assistant built-in devices like Google home to turn your lights on or off with just the power of your voice
Randomize lights to protect your home. Enable ‘away Mode' When you’re away and WeMo will turn lights on and off randomly. Electrical ration: 120V/15a/60Hz/1800W
Note: Works with any one-way connection light switch (not compatible with 3-way) and requires a neutral wire
